definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: It really is of no matter, but I fail to see why you should get so warm over a trifle.
sentences.chinese: 这只不过是个小事，但我不明白你为何如此大动肝火。

sentences.english: She's got into a huff because my brother didn't remember her name.
sentences.chinese: 她因为我的兄弟忘了她的名字而大动肝火。

sentences.english: By Sunday morning, I was so angry with Dr.
sentences.chinese: 但是周日清晨，我对贺博士大闹肝火，我想离开。

sentences.english: Choose to pass the time doing something you enjoy rather than fuming.
sentences.chinese: 用做事来打发时光比大动肝火为好。

sentences.english: Cool down ; there's no need to lose your temper over such a trivial matter.
sentences.chinese: 冷静些，没有必要为如此区区小事而大动肝火。

sentences.english: The accident could bring her out in a temper.
sentences.chinese: 那事件会使她大动肝火。

sentences.english: The boss is up in arms about the company's poor sales record last month.
sentences.chinese: 老板因上个月销售业绩不佳而大动肝火。
这种对比让中国官员大动肝火。

sentences.english: Why should you fly into such a rage at a small thing like this?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么要为这么点的小事而如此地大动肝火呢？

sentences.english: "He is a nervous, bilious subject, " said Larrey;
sentences.chinese: “这是个神经质的，易动肝火的人，”拉雷说。

sentences.english: Irascibility is moved, is blood pressure elevatory ?
Dad is up in arms because you used the car without his permission.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸大动肝火，因为你未经他同意而使用他的汽车。

definition: an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
excess of internal heat due to poor general condition (TCM)/the prestige of another person, which one borrows for oneself
deficiency of yin 陰|阴[yin1] in TCM
spleen and stomach (digestive organs in TCM)/preferences/one's taste (e.g. in literature)
to course the liver and rectify 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
to get angry/to suffer from excessive internal heat (TCM)
to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
